column4: my ATI FireGL T2 128mb card in my IBM T42p laptop is being picky or something. I upgraded to the fglx drivers and all has gone to hell.
I *think* I got it stable now but I'm still not sure.
nope sitll broken. /sigh I guess I'll have to reinstall.

i can't even do that. the screen just stays blank
ctrl + alt + F2 gives you a blank screen?  (ctrl + alt + F7 should take you back to the gui)
I think something got screwy when I did sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx
even in the console my display is all screwy. I think something went wrong durring hte install.

everything was fine till I did apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx
i think what might have killed it was that I did it as sudo instead of root? or perhaps the fact that I turned the root user on to make installing ruby easier.
I doubt it... that's fairly standard stuff.
